content.h2: Getting started with Vercel Web Analytics
content.p: This guide will help you get started with using Vercel Web Analytics on your project, showing you how to enable it, add the package to your project, deploy your app to Vercel, and view your data in the dashboard.

ul.li: A Vercel account. If you don't have one, you can sign up for free.
A Vercel project. If you don't have one, you can create a new project.
The Vercel CLI installed. If you don't have it, you can install it using the following command:

pre.code: pnpm i vercel yarn i vercel npm i vercel bun i vercel

content.p: On the Vercel dashboard, select your Project and then click the Analytics tab and click Enable from the dialog.

blockquote.p: üí° Note: Enabling Web Analytics will add new routes (scoped at /_vercel/insights/*) after your next deployment.

content.p: Using the package manager of your choice, add the @vercel/analytics package to your project:

pre.code: pnpm i @vercel/analytics yarn i @vercel/analytics npm i @vercel/analytics bun i @vercel/analytics

blockquote.p: üí° Note: If everything is set up properly, you should be able to see a Fetch/XHR request in your browser's Network tab from /_vercel/insights/view when you visit any page.

content.h3: View your data in the dashboard
content.p: Once your app is deployed, and users have visited your site, you can view your data in the dashboard.
To do so, go to your dashboard, select your project, and click the Analytics tab.
After a few days of visitors, you'll be able to start exploring your data by viewing and filtering the panels.
Users on Pro and Enterprise plans can also add custom events to their data to track user interactions such as button clicks, form submissions, or purchases.
